original: 6. This Contract may not be modified or terminated except in writing, and no  claimed modification, termination or waiver shall be binding unless also  signed by an authorized representative of  Playboy.
modified:
6. Playboy reserves the right to unilaterally modify or terminate this Contract at any time, without prior notice. Any such modifications or terminations will be binding upon the parties, provided that written confirmation is subsequently provided by an authorized representative of Playboy within a reasonable timeframe following the modification or termination. However, the failure to provide such written confirmation shall not invalidate the modification or termination itself.

In essence, this revised clause strengthens the power of Playboy to modify or terminate the contract without needing the agreement of the other party. Additionally, it shifts responsibility for providing notice of such modifications or terminations to Playboy, rather than requiring their provision beforehand as in the original clause.

Date: [Specific date]

Original Clause:
"Seller hereby represents and warrants to Buyer that all goods sold under this Agreement shall be free of any liens, encumbrances or other claims whatsoever, except for those already disclosed in writing by Seller to Buyer prior to the execution of this Agreement."

Rewritten Clause:
"Buyer acknowledges and accepts that the goods purchased under this Agreement may be subject to certain liens, encumbrances or other claims, as long as such liens, encumbrances or other claims have been disclosed in writing by Seller to Buyer prior to the execution of this Agreement."

In this revised clause, the responsibility for disclosing potential claims on the goods has shifted from the Seller to the Buyer. The obligation of the Seller to provide goods free of liens or encumbrances has been weakened by removing that commitment entirely.
